scene_metadata.title: The Truth in Clay
scene_metadata.philosophical_depth: hands knowing what minds cannot grasp

dialogue.text: *approaching the clay tentatively* But what if I don't know what to make? What if nothing comes?
*shaping without planning* That's perfect. Start there. Let your hands ask the questions your mind can't formulate. The door might appear in what emerges.
*fingers sinking into material* It's so... immediate. No time to think, just... this.

psychological_notes: Evan's fear of not knowing what to make is the perfect starting point - it's honest not-knowing rather than pretended knowledge. The architect's invitation to let hands lead mind reverses our usual hierarchy. Evan's surprise at the immediacy of clay shows how creation bypasses intellectual barriers.
philosophical_underpinning: The body holds wisdom that transcends conceptual understanding
therapeutic_direction: Engaging somatic intelligence through creative action
